briefTitle: A Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Upadacitinib in Participants With Moderately to Severely Active Crohn's Disease Who Have Inadequately Responded to or Are Intolerant to Conventional and/or Biologic Therapies
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Induction Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Upadacitinib (ABT-494) in Subjects With Moderately to Severely Active Crohn's Disease Who Have Inadequately Responded to or Are Intolerant to Conventional and/or Biologic Therapies
summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of upadacitinib compared to placebo as induction therapy in adults with moderately and severely active Crohn's disease (CD).

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Remission Per Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) at Week 12
